intro: Quercus axillaris, commonly known as the Mexican chestnut oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant features broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall, and it produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife. Quercus axillaris typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
